headline: Infosys CEO Parekh gets 22% pay hike in FY25, stays second-highest paid IT CEO
intro: The highest paid IT executive remains HCL Technologies Ltd CEO C. Vijayakumar, according to the company's FY24 annual report. Infosys added nine crorepati employees in FY25.
imagecaption: Around  ?49.5 crore of Infosys Ltd CEO Salil Parekh?s compensation came from shares exercised by him in FY25.

headline: Tech Mahindra taps US-based exec Santosh Jha to lead GCC push amid industry-wide shift
intro: The appointment of Santosh Kumar Jha makes Tech Mahindra the fourth major IT firm to name a head of global capability centres in recent months
imagecaption: Tech Mahindra, under chief executive Mohit Joshi, is betting on the GCC business as one of its key growth levers. (File Photo: Mint)

headline: The week in charts: Sensex cheer, tariff truce, satellite scheme
intro: In this weekly Plain Facts compilation, we present to you data-based insights, with easy-to-read charts, to help you delve deeper into the stories reported by Mint in the week gone by.
imagecaption: The Sensex climbed 3.7% to 82,429.90 on Monday, marking its best gains since 1 February 2021. (Image: Pixabay)

headline: BPO companies can better navigate Gen AI, macro uncertainty than IT cos
intro: Part of this is due to the nature of BPO companies' work, which does not depend on clients' non-essential expenditure to earn revenue.
imagecaption: Investors in Indian IT stocks are interested only in growth prospects of large and mid-sized software exporters; although Nasscom also captures the performance of pure play BPOs and companies that are set-up by multinationals to provide captive services. Photo: Mint

headline: Stock Picks: Sagar Doshi suggests Divis Lab, HCL Tech, Marico shares to buy amid Indo-Pak conflict

headline: Nifty IT extends falls for 4th straight month in April, posts longest losing streak in nearly a decade
intro: Nifty IT index ended April down 3%, marking a four-month losing streak. Seven of ten index constituents, including Coforge and Wipro, saw declines. Despite a recent rebound, the index remains in bear territory, impacted by global trade tensions and cautious forecasts from major IT firms.
imagecaption: IT stocks in focus: Nifty IT extends losing streak to 4th straight month in April; longest losing streak in nearly a decade

headline: LIC hikes stake in HCL Technologies to 5%. Details here
intro: Life Insurance Corporations of India (LIC), on Tuesday, said it has increased its stake in tech firm HCL Technologies from 4.83 per cent to 5 per cent.
imagecaption: LIC hikes stake in HCL Technologies to 5%. Details here

headline: HCL Technologies share price in focus as stock trades ex-dividend today
intro: Stock Market Today: HCL Technologies share price remains in focus on Monday as it trades ex-dividend today. The record date to identify the list of eligible shareholders to receive the dividend also stands as 28 April 2025.
imagecaption: Stock Market Today: HCL Technologies record date for dividend today.
